mdRecord.dcterms:title: Visiting speaker Paul Kennedy
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "Two indisputable trends are sweeping us into the future: technological innovation and population growth, but they are not necessarily compatible," historian Paul Kennedy told a packed house in the Newman Pavilion at the White Burkett Miller Center of Public Affairs on September 10, 1993.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
University of Virginia. News Office--Press coverage
